title: PG&E Power Lines Remain Risky to California, Even During Blackouts
text:
The failure of a PG&E Corp. power line minutes before a wildfire broke out in California’s wine country starkly shows how the company’s electric system continues to pose risks to the safety of millions of residents, even as it takes desperate measures to reduce the threat of fire.

The San Francisco-based utility, which provides gas and electric service to 16 million people, or roughly one in 20 Americans, disclosed that one of its high-voltage transmission lines malfunctioned shortly before the Kincade Fire ignited Wednesday...
description: The failure of a PG&E power line minutes before a wildfire broke out in California’s wine country starkly shows how the company’s electric system continues to pose risks to the safety of millions of residents.
